settings.text: We have summarized the most frequently asked questions from our customers about men's hair replacement systems for your reference. If you have any other questions, feel free to contact us at support@lavividhair.com.

settings.html_content:
TOP 3 Common Questions

Where are you located? Do you have salons where I can try on hair systems?

LaVivid has offices in the United States and Asia, providing reliable global shipping services to customers worldwide.

We collaborate with a network of partner salons. If you can't find a salon near you to try on, please check our list of partner salons to see if there's any close to you.

How long will I receive the hair system after I place my order?

Delivery time depends on your location and the inventory availability. It includes processing and shipping. Stock hair systems take 3-4 business days to process, while custom orders take about 4-6 weeks.

For US orders, shipping will take 5-7 business days while for other countries and regions is 7-10 business days. Delays may occur due to crises, holidays, or other uncontrollable factors.

Can I return the product?

We accept returns and exchanges on eligible products within 45 days of delivery. To qualify, items must be in their original condition (unaltered, unworn, undamaged), with all tags and packaging intact.

For custom orders, pre-cut items, and clearance products please refer to our latest return policy. Ineligible products will be returned at your cost. Once we receive the return, we'll contact you to process an exchange or refund.

settings.question: How long will my hair system last?
settings.answer: It depends on the base design of the hair system and how well the wearer looks after their hair system. Thin skin base can usually last 2-4 months, depending on skin thickness. The thicker the skin, the longer the lifespan. Lace base and mono base can last 3-6 months, while silk base can last up to 9 months.

settings.question: Which is the most natural and durable hair system?
settings.answer: For the front hairline area, a thin skin base and lace base can both offer you a super natural look, while a silk base can guarantee you a scalp-like top. You can go for a combo base with a lace front.

settings.question: What type of hair system would you recommend for a first-time hair system wearer?
settings.answer: A skin hair system is a great choice as it doesn't have any holes compared to a lace/mono/silk base. If you plan to use glue, which adheres more effectively than tape, skin bases are easier to remove, clean, and maintain.

settings.question: Can you cut the hair before shipping?
settings.answer: Yes! We offer a pre-cut and styling service for an additional fee. You can choose from over 20 hairstyles or share your preferred style, and we'll be happy to accommodate your request.

settings.question: Are there any discounts for new customers?
settings.answer: We offer a $40 discount on your first order when you create an account with us. This discount can be applied to any ongoing sale.

settings.question: Do you have tutorials or blogs for new customers?
settings.answer: Yes, we have a detailed hair system page for new beginners and a Free Training E-course to help new customers. This free training e-course includes basic knowledge about hair systems, how to prepare your head before application, how to apply the system, how to maintain it, what hair products you will need, how to pick the best-performing tape or glue, and much more.

settings.question: I am looking for the most secure attachment. Which base shall I choose?
settings.answer: If bonded correctly, all of our hair systems can provide you with a secure attachment. If you care for your hair system properly (by removing, cleaning, and re-bonding every 1-2 weeks), it will stay securely. Nevertheless, if you are looking for the strongest attachment, many of our clients have the best experience with the full skin base. You need to apply liquid adhesive all over the scalp, which guarantees the most secure fit.

settings.question: Will wearing a hair system cause any damage to my scalp? I haven't completely ruled out the possibility of a hair transplant in the future.
settings.answer: It will not damage your scalp or existing hair, provided the hair system is kept clean and maintained correctly. The hair system may actually provide protection to a certain extent against the sun and will protect sensitive scalps from the elements. It is also necessary to pay attention to whether your skin is allergic to glue/tapes. Do a small test on your skin before applying it to your scalp.

settings.question: I work out a lot and spend most of my time sweating. Which system is the most breathable and suitable for a very active lifestyle?
settings.answer: Full lace hair systems are the most breathable and light-weight styles. We also have combined bases of lace which are also breathable and easy to apply and remove. We recommend you remove the hair system and do a thorough clean once a week if you sweat a lot.

settings.question: What can you tell me about lace systems?
settings.answer: Lace systems feature a lightweight mesh, such as French or Swiss lace, for a natural hairline and scalp look. French lace is slightly thicker and more durable than Swiss lace, but both excel in breathability, ideal for active lifestyles. For more base details, please visit the LaVivid Base Guide.

settings.question: Will the lace match my skin color?
settings.answer: Yes, our default lace material is transparent Swiss lace, which blends seamlessly with all skin tones for a natural look. For custom orders, you can also choose brown/beige or black lace.

settings.question: Can you provide information on hybrid hair systems and how their durability compares to full poly systems?
settings.answer: Hybrid hair systems combine lace and skin to bring out the best of both materials. For instance, our Simois hair system features a central lace base for a soft, breathable feel, paired with thin PU skin along the perimeter for easy attachment and removal, plus a front lace section for a natural, seamless hairline. Full skin systems, on the other hand, often use a V-loop technique at the front to achieve a realistic hairline. With thicker skin, they offer strong support for denser hair and excellent durability, typically lasting longer than hybrids, depending on the skin's thickness.

settings.question: Is shipping free?
settings.answer: Free shipping over $179 for the US and over $249 for other countries. For Wholesale Accounts: The shipping charge for bulk wholesale orders is $30 for the first piece, plus $3 for each additional unit, applicable to all countries.

settings.question: What is Route?
settings.answer: Route automatically connects to everything you've ordered from all your favorite retailers while allowing you to visually track your packages, anytime, anywhere. Add Route Package Protection at checkout and unlock full package protection and seamless resolution for order issues.

settings.question: Do you have package insurance through ROUTE?
settings.answer: We offer Route Shipping Protection at checkout to help protect against this unwanted experience. It is available for purchase for a very small fee at checkout when selecting your shipping method. Both our international and domestic customers can opt-in for Route. Customers who are protected under Route can file claims to receive a replacement or a refund back for packages that are lost in transit, arrive damaged, or are stolen. The claim filing process includes three steps and is completely self-serve and easy to do.

settings.question: How to track my order via Route?
settings.answer: You can view your deliveries in the Route mobile app to get a real-time view of where all of your packages are. On the MAP screen, you can swipe through cards or zoom into the map to see where packages are in-transit. Tap on a card to open up the Order Details page. You can also see a list view of all your packages on the Orders screen. From there, you can tap on orders to see the order details which will provide info about where your order is in transit.

settings.question: What if my order never arrives, is stolen, or arrives damaged?
settings.answer: When you add Route+, you can easily file claims for lost, stolen, or damaged packages in the unfortunate case that they arise. When you file a claim, it will be reviewed for approval for a reorder or refund within 24 hours.

settings.question: How do I file a claim for my lost, stolen, or damaged order via Route?
settings.answer:
If you insured your order with Route+ at checkout, you will receive a confirmation email from Route with a link to file a claim. You can also file a claim here. Make sure to have the Order ID we sent you or the Route Order ID ready to use with the claim form.

An item is considered 'lost' if it is never reported as 'delivered,' if 7 days have passed since the last tracking status update for domestic shipments, and 20 days for international shipments, including Canada. A claim must be filed within 30 days of the last tracking update.

The route will consider a package 'stolen' if the package is marked 'delivered' but the customer did not receive it. A claim must be filed within 30 days of the 'delivery date,' but no sooner than 5 days to account for the possibility that the package may be found on the premises or has been marked 'delivered' prematurely by the carrier.

Click to learn more about Route Protection Policies

settings.question: Is Route a licensed insurance company?
settings.answer: Yes. Route is a licensed insurance company with the biggest name in shipping insurance as its partner, Lloyds of London.

settings.question: How often do I have to replace a hair system?
settings.answer: It mainly depends on which base you choose for the hair system because different bases have different lifespans. Our ultra-thin skin base (0.03mm) has a lifespan of about 2 months while our Silk base hair system can last up to a year with correct care. Besides this, the frequency you wear it and the way how you care for and maintain your hair system also affect its lifespan.

settings.question: How long should I have the hair system bonding on my head once I put it on?
settings.answer: The total time of bonding depends on factors like the adhesive used, your skin type, the climate, and your lifestyle. We recommend you only remove it and get it cleaned every 1-2 weeks to extend the lifespan of the hair system. If you don't sweat a lot and live in a dry climate, you can leave it on for a longer time, about 2-4 weeks. If you attach a lace hair system with liquid adhesive, we don't recommend you to wear it for more than two weeks in a row. If you wear it for too long time, the adhesive will penetrate through the lace which makes it very difficult to clean.

settings.question: I have problems with removing the tape from the lace base of my hair system. Do you have any tips for this?
settings.answer: Before removing the lace hair system from the scalp, apply the spray adhesive remover to the area where the tape is and soak the tape for several minutes. Find the edge of the base in the back and lift it a little. Then use a towel to remove the tapes gently.

settings.question: Can I swim, shower, or sleep with my hair system on?
settings.answer: Yes. You can definitely sleep, swim, and shower with it on and probably do anything in it. It shouldn't stop you from doing anything. However, chlorine in pools can be harmful to the hair and make the hair drier. So, we would recommend you deep condition the hair after you go swimming to help refresh the hair.

settings.question: I swim a lot. Which kind of adhesive should I use for the most secure attachment?
settings.answer: If your hair is exposed to water frequently, you are strongly recommended to use water-proof tape or adhesives. It is proved that acrylic adhesives (Ultra Hold) or a Blue Liner Lace tape functions very well for secure attachment.

settings.question: I work out a lot and spend most of my time sweating. Which system is the most breathable and suitable for a very active lifestyle?
settings.answer: Full lace hair systems are the most breathable and light-weight styles. We also have combined bases of lace and skin which are also breathable and easy to apply and remove. We recommend you remove the hair system and do a thorough clean once a week if you sweat a lot every day.

settings.question: Do you offer a customization service?
settings.answer: Yes, we do. We offer a convenient individual service to create the most suitable hair system based on your specific needs. You can choose the hair material, color, texture, density, base construction, base size, base shape, and hair direction of your hair system to make a perfect match. Please click here to get a quote.

settings.question: Will the lace match my skin color?
settings.answer: The lace color of all the stock hair systems is beige. If you need the lace in other colors, please contact our customer service at support@lavividhair.com for customization.

settings.question: Can I customize different density in different sections of the base?
settings.answer: Yes. Many of our customers order a lighter density in the front hairline to create a natural graduated appearance. We can also offer a lighter density around the perimeter to blend in with your hair seamlessly.

settings.question: How can I become a partner salon with LaVivid?
settings.answer: Please submit the required information and materials here. We'll get back to you within 24 hours. Once your application is approved, you'll be able to log into your salon account and start purchasing directly.

settings.question: I'm a salon owner looking to grow my business. Does LaVivid offer training for salons?
settings.answer: LaVivid partners with hair system educators globally and is continuously expanding our network of educators and hair replacement specialists. For more information, please check out the Salon Training page.

settings.section_subtitle: The best hair system isn't just about material — it's about how you live and how you wear your hair. To make your choice simple, we've grouped hair systems into three lifestyle types and with adhesive recommendations for quick and confident selection.
settings.lifestyle_1_description: Meetings, social events, visible hairline styles
settings.lifestyle_1_hair_best_for: Invisible hairline, Natural appearance, Professional settings
settings.lifestyle_2_description: Gym, sports, outdoor work, frequent sweating
settings.lifestyle_3_description: Daily use, long hours, comfort-first users
